Description: Mould-made amuletic figure in glazed composition, representing a male Egyptian deity; wearing the Pschent double crown; suspension loop pierced widthways behind crown; light turquoise glaze, bit decayed; cream fine paste; very fragmentary, only head preserved.
Curator's comments: Found unregistered, but with other objects from Naukratis with labels from the EEF from Petrie's excavations at Naukratis in 1885.

Two labels that were found in the box indicated finds from the Temple of Apollo in Naukratis, VIth cent. B.C. They concerned a "glazed-sand figure" and a "glazed-sand head". This amulet could represent the latter.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.185) (phase 3)
